bibl.title: Letter from Felipe Carbonell Ponce to Philip Showalter Hench, January 12, 1942

div1.p: Ponce describes his attempts to publicize and gain Cuban government support for the proposed Camp Lazear memorial.

div1.head: Letter from Felipe Carbonell Ponce to Philip Showalter Hench, January 12, 1942
div1.opener:
Have been get
my report to Ramos
Habana Lúnes12 de Enero de 1942.
Dr. Phillip S. Hench.
Mayo Clinic. Rochester. Minn.
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
nabout two weeks ago I received the tenth of December
issue of the Mayo Clinic proceedings. Having found most interesting your
article “Conquerors of the Yellow Fever” I translated it and took it to
“Salas Radio Station”.

Headed by Dr. Donald Nelson, a group of americans doctors were
expected in Havana at that time for the formation of the Finlay Institute
of the Americas. Thinking this was an apropiate moment Mr. Salas and I
decided to inform the President of the Republic of your article and get
his help for making Camp Lazear an international monument to the medical
classes of Cuba and the United States. On the same day that the President
decorated the american doctors, Mr. Salas spoke to him and got his most
enthusiastic aproval. The President called Dr. Sergio Garćía Marruz, (ac-
ting Minister of Health and giving him my trnslation of your article
begged of him a speedy study and in formation. Dr. G. Marruz found it
extremely important and secunded our idea warmly.

Mr. Salas inmediatly informed the public over the air and has considered
this scheme his most important transmission.

Last Saturday Salas and I went together to visit Dr. G. Marruz and talked to him
for more than two hours of this subject. He is taking to-day Monday, this
question to the Council of Ministers, at the Presidents request, to be
discussed. They will try to find the way to solve this problem, and will
probably have to send a message to the Congress to get his aproval. This
is the actual situation.

As Mr. Pogolotti and John J. Moran were mentioned in your article,
I look for Mr. Pogolotti in the telephone book as soon as Mr. Salas had
spoken to the President and made a date with him at the hospital where
I work, to visit Camp Lazear. The next day Mr. Salas and I had the plea-
sure of meeting the most kindly Mr. Pogolotti and we all together visited,
first the false site and then the real Camp Lazear at the San José farm.
Mr. Pogolotti imformed us of your extraordinary interest and work on this
subject. He also gave us Mr. Moran's address and the same afternoon I paid
him a visit. There I also heard many things about you.

According to what I had read in your article, Mrs Morans and Pogolottis
information and what I already knew personally, I wrote the notes that
Dr. G. Marruz is taking to-day to the Council. I think that the Cuban
Government can raise a building having Camp Lazear in its center, more or
less following the sketch you gave to Mr. Pogolotti.

It is my idea, and I think also the Presidents to make a
ceremony at the dedication of this memorial.

I am looking forward to an interview with the President,
and then if this takes place, I will send you more details about the
venture.

I want to give you my ideas about this subject. I understand that the
would be memorial building, should be a monument to the Cuban and ameri-
can medical classes. It is my intention not to accept discussions as to
wether the monument should be dedicated to any special person. I have
the impression, drawn from your article that you have the same opinion.
I sincerely believe that is the only way in which we can carry out our
idea with success.

I want you to know that my interest in this subject is graetly
intensified by the fact that you are a doctor of the Mayo Clinic that
I visited twice, and where Dr. Fred Rankin removed my thyroid gland
years ago with the greatest success.

I hope to receive your opinion and any ideas that you have
for this memorial project as soon as posible.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours Dr. Felipe Carbonell Ponce. San Lázaro 413
Habana Cuba.
P.S.
I am decidedly against transferring Camp Lazear to any other site.
